message.content:
Tom washed 10 pairs of socks, and it took him 10 hours for them to dry in the sun. Therefore, each pair of socks dried at a rate of 1/10 of a pair per hour. To find out how long it will take to dry seven pairs of socks under the same conditions, we can simply divide the total number of pairs (7) by the rate of drying (1/10 of a pair per hour):

Time = Number of Pairs / Rate of Drying
Time = 7 / (1/10)
Time = 7 * 10
Time = 70 hours

Therefore, it will take Tom 70 hours to dry seven pairs of socks under the same weather conditions. However, this is just an estimate and the actual time may vary depending on factors such as the amount of sunlight, humidity, and wind. Additionally, if Tom wants to speed up the drying process, he could use a clothes dryer or hang the socks in a well-ventilated area with good air circulation.|im_end|>
